summary: An email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (Public Affairs) discussing CNN pursuing a story about the 2015/2016 Epstein plea deal in Florida. The email notes CNN spoke to an unnamed AUSA about sex/human trafficking concerns not raised to senior leadership, and that CNN may run the story if competitors do.

persons.name: Public Affairs U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Sends an email providing an update on CNN's pursuit of a story regarding the Epstein plea deal and seeking guidance.

events.title: Epstein plea deal in Florida
events.description: Reference to the plea deal involving Jeffrey Epstein in Florida, which is the subject of CNN's story pursuit.

events.title: Epstein plea deal concerns
events.description: Continuation of the plea deal timeline, with CNN investigating how concerns about sex/human trafficking were not raised to senior leadership.

events.title: CNN story pursuit email
events.description: Email sent discussing CNN's active pursuit of a story on the Epstein plea deal, indicating potential media coverage.
personsInvolved: Public Affairs U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York

keyFacts: CNN is pursuing a story about the 2015/2016 Epstein plea deal in Florida.
CNN spoke to an unnamed Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) who indicated concerns about sex trafficking or human trafficking were not raised to senior leadership at the time.
The email suggests CNN may run the story if competitors do, indicating media pressure on the issue.
The email originates from the Public Affairs office of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking internal guidance.
